verses.verse: In Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> I take refuge. <S%H2620><s%> How can you say <S%H559><s%> to my soul, <S%H5315><s%> "Flee <S%H5110><s%> as a bird <S%H6833><s%> to your mountain! <S%H2022><s%>"

For, <S%H7563><s%> behold, the wicked bend <S%H1869><s%> their bows. <S%H7198><s%> They set <S%H3559><s%> their arrows <S%H2671><s%> on the strings, <S%H3499><s%> that they may shoot <S%H3384><s%> in darkness <S%H652><s%> at the upright <S%H3477><s%> in heart. <S%H3820><s%>
If the foundations <S%H8356><s%> are destroyed, <S%H2040><s%> what can the righteous <S%H6662><s%> do? <S%H6466><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is in his holy <S%H6944><s%> temple. <S%H1964><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is on his throne <S%H3678><s%> in heaven. <S%H8064><s%> His eyes <S%H5869><s%> observe. <S%H2372><s%> His eyes <S%H6079><s%> examine <S%H974><s%> the children <S%H1121><s%> of men. <S%H120><s%>
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> examines <S%H974><s%> the righteous, <S%H6662><s%> but the wicked <S%H7563><s%> and him who loves <S%H157><s%> violence <S%H2555><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> hates. <S%H8130><s%>

On the wicked <S%H7563><s%> he will rain <S%H4305><s%> blazing coals; <S%H6341><s%> fire, <S%H784><s%> sulfur, <S%H1614><s%> and scorching <S%H2152><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> shall be the portion <S%H4521><s%> of their cup. <S%H3563><s%>
For Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> is righteous. <S%H6662><s%> He loves <S%H157><s%> righteousness. <S%H6666><s%> The upright <S%H3477><s%> shall see <S%H2372><s%> his face. <S%H6440><s%>
